meanings.definition: A writing falsely attributed to a famous author.
meanings.sent1: The professor explained that the ancient scroll was a pseudepigraph.
meanings.sent2: The library contained many pseudepigraphs that confused historians.
meanings.sent3: The detective found a pseudepigraph in the mystery novel, adding a twist to the plot.
meanings.sent4: Her diary entry was like a pseudepigraph, hiding her true feelings behind a mask.
meanings.sent5: The pseudepigraph was like a puzzle, challenging readers to uncover the truth.

meanings.definition: A work falsely ascribed to a biblical character.
meanings.sent1: The religious scholar studied the pseudepigraph found in the ancient texts.
meanings.sent2: Many pseudepigraphs were discovered in the archaeological dig, sparking debate.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about finding a pseudepigraph in the Bible, causing laughter in the audience.
meanings.sent4: The legend of King Arthur could be seen as a pseudepigraph, blending history and myth.
meanings.sent5: The pseudepigraph added a mysterious aura to the biblical narrative, captivating readers.
